title: How to Get Charmander in Pokémon Emerald

steps.title: Open up the Cheats menu of your GBA emulator.
steps.content: Open up the Cheats menu of your GBA emulator. Tap the menu button on your interface and hit the “Cheats” option on the menu that pops up. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Enter the Master Code into the emulator.
steps.content: Enter the Master Code into the emulator. Gameshark requires a Master Code to be inputted before any other cheat codes: [2] X Research source D8BAE4D9 4864DCE5 A86CDBA5 19BA49B3

steps.title: Type 28302DAD BF3BEFBA to get Charmander.
steps.content: Type 28302DAD BF3BEFBA to get Charmander. The next time you encounter a Pokémon in the wild, it will be a Charmander. [3] X Research source Charmeleon cheat code: A7E65BC2 5B3D7499 Charizard cheat code: A72AB10A 7F70076E

steps.title: Meet the minimum requirements for trading in both LG/FR and Emerald.
steps.content: Meet the minimum requirements for trading in both LG/FR and Emerald. The player who has LeafGreen or FireRed needs to have unlocked the National Pokédex. They also need to have collected the Ruby and Sapphire from Mt. Ember to power up the Network Machine on the Sevii Islands. You (the player with Pokémon Emerald) also need to have the National Pokédex unlocked before you can trade with a FireRed or LeafGreen game. [4] X Research source In Pokémon Emerald, Professor Birch automatically upgrades your Pokédex after you beat the Pokémon League. [5] X Research source In Pokémon FireRed and LeafGreen, Professor Oak will upgrade your Pokédex after you’ve conquered the Pokémon League and you’ve encountered at least 60 Pokémon at that point. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Head to the center booth on the second floor of a Pokémon Center.
steps.content: Head to the center booth on the second floor of a Pokémon Center. In both Emerald and LeafGreen/FireRed, visit the person at the center counter. The game will confirm that you want to trade Pokémon and save your game. Then, both in-game screens will read “Please wait.” [7] X Research source

steps.title: Trade using the Game Link Cable .
steps.content: Trade using the Game Link Cable . Plug one end of the Game Link Cable into the corresponding port on the back of each GBA console, making sure that each connection is secure. When both ends of the cable are plugged in, follow the on-screen instructions to complete your Charmander trade. [8] X Research source Alternative: You can use the GBA Wireless Adapter to trade if both you and your friend have it—just make sure it’s plugged in before you boot up your games. The second floor of the Pokémon Center will automatically be configured to the Wireless Adapter when the accessory is plugged in.
